Some
licensed funeral directors and embalmers may meet the duties requirements for
the learned professional exemption.  In order to meet the duties requirements
of the exemption, licensed funeral directors and embalmers must be licensed by
and working in a state that requires successful completion of four academic
years of pre-professional and professional study, including graduation from a
college of mortuary science accredited by the American Board of Funeral Service
Education.  Some employees with the job title of “funeral director” or
“embalmer” have not completed the four years of post-secondary education
required by 29 CFR § 541.301(e)(9) and are not, therefore, exempt as learned
professionals.   29
CFR § 541.301(e)(9) 69
